title: How to Convert Images and PDF Files to Editable Text

steps.title: Go to https://www.drive.google.com.
steps.content: Go to https://www.drive.google.com . Log on if you aren’t already. You need a Google account to use this service. It is free to sign up and use 15 GB storage size.

steps.title: Click the gear icon.
steps.content: Click the gear icon. It’s at the far-right of the screen, below your username initial.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings .

steps.title: Tick the “Convert Uploads” box.
steps.content: Tick the “Convert Uploads” box.

steps.title: Click Done.
steps.content: Click Done .

steps.title: Click My Drive.
steps.content: Click My Drive . My Drive is at the upper-left corner of the window below the search bar and has a drop-down arrow.

steps.title: Click Upload Files.
steps.content: Click Upload Files .

steps.title: Find a scanned file and click it.
steps.content: Find a scanned file and click it.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open .

steps.title: Find the uploaded file.
steps.content: Find the uploaded file. You should see it in the list of files in your Drive. If you don’t see the file, make sure the button on the far-right of your drive next to the arrow says “Last Modified.” If it doesn’t, click it and select that option.

steps.title: Right-click the scanned file.
steps.content: Right-click the scanned file.

steps.title: Hover your mouse on “Open With.”
steps.content: Hover your mouse on “Open With.” You should see an option for “Google Docs.”

steps.title: Click “Google Docs.”
steps.content: Click “Google Docs.” Your file will open as an editable Google Doc. You can download the converted file to editable file formats, like Microsoft Word (.docx) and Plain Text (.txt) by selecting “Download” instead of “Open With Google Docs” when you right-click the file you uploaded.

steps.title: Open your browser and go to https://www.onlineocr.net/.
steps.content: Open your browser and go to https://www.onlineocr.net/ . This is the website for Free Online OCR, a web-based program that lets you convert files into editable DOCX, XLSX, or TXT windows displayed at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Click Select file....
steps.content: Click Select file... . This will open a new window where you can search for a PDF or image to upload to the site for conversion. Note that the maximum file size for uploading onto this site is 15 MB, so don't upload a large file onto this site unless it's less than 15 MB.

steps.title: Select a file for conversion.
steps.content: Select a file for conversion. Once in the file selection window, navigate to the file you want to edit and click Open .

steps.title: Select the language and format for conversion.
steps.content: Select the language and format for conversion. In the middle of the menu on the website are two drop-down menus, the left being for the language and the right being for the format. Toggle both to your desired settings.

steps.title: Click CONVERT.
steps.content: Click CONVERT . This will start the process of converting your PDF or image into text and usually takes a few seconds to calibrate.

steps.title: Edit the text in the text box.
steps.content: Edit the text in the text box. Once the file has been converted, it'll appear in the box at the bottom of the screen. If you want to make any edits to the text, feel free to do so at this point.

steps.title: Click Download Output File.
steps.content: Click Download Output File . This appears above the text box and will save your converted PDF or image into a DOCX, XLSX, or TXT file. This step is optional.

steps.title: Open Adobe Acrobat.
steps.content: Open Adobe Acrobat. If you have it on your computer, it'll have a red icon with a stylized white "A" in it and can be accessed from your desktop screen. Note that you have to have an Adobe ID in order to access Adobe's OCR feature for editing PDFs, which requires you to sign up for a paid Adobe account with access to different tools.

steps.title: Click Open.
steps.content: Click Open . This will open a new window where you can navigate to, and select, a PDF file to open.

steps.title: Click Tools.
steps.content: Click Tools . This is located in the top-left corner of the Acrobat menu, next to the Open tab, and will pull up the menu for you to access any tools you have installed on Acrobat.

steps.title: Click Recognize Text.
steps.content: Click Recognize Text . This will activate the OCR feature in Adobe Acrobat.

steps.title: Select In This File.
steps.content: Select In This File . This will ensure the OCR program only converts text in the specific PDF you have opened. Click Edit to adjust the parameters for the text recognition scan.

steps.title: Click OK.
steps.content: Click OK . This will start the character recognition process in Adobe Acrobat.

steps.title: Select the text you want to edit.
steps.content: Select the text you want to edit. Once you have the Recognize Text feature enabled, you can simply click on and highlight the text you want to edit in your PDF file.
